availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Rebecca "Polly" Morse Williams in Caldwell County, Kentucky on December 28, 1833. Father of McCoy Williams, John A. Williams, James J. Williams, Keziah J. Williams, Nancy K. Williams, Mary A. Williams, Robert Williams, Elizabeth Williams, and Flavilla J. Williams. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1840. Owned eight enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1840. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned twenty-two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned at least one enslaved man, including Wesley, in 1859.

Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Administrators Bonds, 1852-1862, p. 159.
